intro: Viola minor, commonly known as the common violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces delicate flowers in shades of purple, violet, and white. Viola minor thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland areas or gardens. It is known for its ability to bloom early in the spring, often before the leaves of many trees have fully emerged.
